meanings.definition: To improvise or make something work using whatever materials are available.
meanings.sent1: She was kluging together a costume for the school play using old clothes and cardboard.
meanings.sent2: When the car broke down, he started kluging with tools from his garage to get it running again.
meanings.sent3: The chef was kluging a new recipe with unusual ingredients, and surprisingly, it turned out delicious.
meanings.sent4: In a pinch, she was kluging a solution to the problem, like a magician pulling a rabbit out of a hat.
meanings.sent5: The kids were kluging a fort out of blankets and chairs, their imaginations running wild.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a makeshift solution or repair.
meanings.sent1: His kluging of the broken toy impressed his friends, who thought he was a genius.
meanings.sent2: The kluging of the leaky pipe held up until the plumber could arrive to fix it properly.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut's kluging of the damaged spaceship saved the crew from disaster.
meanings.sent4: The artist's kluging of the sculpture gave it a unique charm that no one could replicate.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kluging of the lesson plan made the class fun and engaging for the students.

meanings.sent1: The kluging on the tire got him to the mechanic for a proper repair.
meanings.sent2: She applied a quick kluging to the torn page to keep it from falling out of the book.
meanings.sent3: The kluging on the roof stopped the leak for now, but they knew it was just a temporary solution.
meanings.sent4: His kluging of the computer issue bought him some time until the IT department could address it.
meanings.sent5: The kluging on the broken chair leg made it usable again, at least for the time being.
